title: Invertible Transforms for Matrices
text: goal invertiforms provide composable, invertible transformations sparse matrices. transformations primarily useful network analysis. example, provide transforms row column center graph adjacency matrix. transformation composed degree-normalized transformation, . original adjacency matrix can recovered applying inverse transformation. Primarily, package developers working spectral matrix packages, may also useful advanced users don’t want go hassle coding matrix transformations .

title: Invertible Transforms for Matrices

title: Invertible Transforms for Matrices
text: moment, provide convenient tools : row center, column center, row column center matrix. Similarly, provide tools transform graph adjacency matrix : normalized graph Laplacian, regularized graph Laplacian, perturbed graph Laplacian.

title: Invertible Transforms for Matrices
text: show invertiforms might help quickly perform regularized spectral clustering. First grab network data quickly visualize adjacency matrix.  Now construct regularized degree normalized graph Laplacian visualize .  Recovering L straightforward: L can spectral tricks . estimate k = 2 clusters.
code: library(invertiforms) #> Loading required package: Matrix #>  #> Attaching package: 'invertiforms' #> The following object is masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     transform library(igraph) #>  #> Attaching package: 'igraph' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     decompose, spectrum #> The following object is masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     union library(igraphdata)  data("karate", package = "igraphdata")  A <- get.adjacency(karate) image(A) iform <- RegularizedLaplacian(A, tau_row = 35, tau_col = 35)  L <- transform(iform, A) image(L) A_recovered <- inverse_transform(iform, L)  all.equal(A, A_recovered) #> [1] TRUE set.seed(27)  k <- 2 L_svd <- svd(L, k)  safe_project_sphere_rowwise <- function(x, eps = 1e-10) {   sc <- drop(apply(x, 1L, function(y) sum(y^2)))   sc[sc < eps] <- 1   x / sqrt(sc) }  U <- safe_project_sphere_rowwise(L_svd$u) km <- kmeans(U, k, nstart = 50)  V(karate)$color <- km$cluster plot(karate)

title: Construct and use DoubleCenter transformations — DoubleCenter
text: DoubleCenter() creates DoubleCenter object. transform() returns transformed matrix, typically sparseLRMatrix::sparseLRMatrix. inverse_transform() returns inverse transformed matrix, typically sparseLRMatrix::sparseLRMatrix cases. possible reduces sparseLRMatrix::sparseLRMatrix Matrix::sparseMatrix().

title: Construct and use DoubleCenter transformations — DoubleCenter
code: library(igraph) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘igraph’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     decompose, spectrum #> The following object is masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     union library(igraphdata)  data("karate", package = "igraphdata")  A <- get.adjacency(karate)  iform <- DoubleCenter(A)  A_tilde <- transform(iform, A) A_recovered <- inverse_transform(iform, A_tilde)  all.equal(A, A_recovered) #> [1] TRUE

title: Construct and use the Normalized Laplacian — NormalizedLaplacian
text: matrix transform. iform Invertiform object describing transformation.

title: Construct and use the Normalized Laplacian — NormalizedLaplacian
text: NormalizedLaplacian() creates NormalizedLaplacian object. transform() returns transformed matrix, typically Matrix. inverse_transform() returns inverse transformed matrix, typically Matrix.

title: Construct and use the Normalized Laplacian — NormalizedLaplacian
text: define normalized Laplacian \(L()\) \(n \times n\) graph adjacency matrix \(\) $$   L()_{ij} = \frac{A_{ij}}{\sqrt{d^{}_i} \sqrt{d^{}_j}} $$ $$   d^{}_i = \sum_{j=1}^n \| A_{ij} \| $$ $$   d^{}_j = \sum_{=1}^n \| A_{ij} \|. $$ \(A_{ij}\) denotes present edge node \(\) node \(j\), fairly standard notation, \(d^{}_i\) denotes (absolute) -degree node \(\) \(d^{}_j\) denotes (absolute) -degree node \(j\). Note documentation renders clearly https://rohelab.github.io/invertiforms/.

title: Construct and use the Normalized Laplacian — NormalizedLaplacian
code: library(igraph) library(igraphdata)  data("karate", package = "igraphdata")  A <- get.adjacency(karate)  iform <- NormalizedLaplacian(A)  L <- transform(iform, A) A_recovered <- inverse_transform(iform, L)  all.equal(A, A_recovered) #> [1] TRUE

title: Construct and use the Perturbed Laplacian — PerturbedLaplacian
text: matrix transform. tau Additive regularizer row column sums abs(). Typically corresponds inflating (absolute) -degree (absolute) -degree node tau. Defaults NULL, case set tau mean value abs(). iform Invertiform object describing transformation.

title: Construct and use the Perturbed Laplacian — PerturbedLaplacian
text: PerturbedLaplacian() creates PerturbedLaplacian object. transform() returns transformed matrix, typically Matrix. inverse_transform() returns inverse transformed matrix, typically Matrix.

title: Construct and use the Perturbed Laplacian — PerturbedLaplacian
text: define perturbed Laplacian \(L^\tau()\) \(n \times n\) graph adjacency matrix \(\) $$   L^\tau()_{ij} = \frac{A_{ij} + \frac{\tau}{n}}{\sqrt{d^{}_i + \tau}   \sqrt{d^{}_j + \tau}} $$ $$   d^{}_i = \sum_{j=1}^n \|A_{ij} \| $$ $$   d^{}_j = \sum_{=1}^n \|A_{ij} \|. $$ \(A_{ij}\) denotes present edge node \(\) node \(j\), fairly standard notation, \(d^{}_i\) denotes (absolute) -degree node \(\) \(d^{}_j\) denotes (absolute) -degree node \(j\). Note documentation renders clearly https://rohelab.github.io/invertiforms/.

title: Construct and use the Regularized Laplacian — RegularizedLaplacian
text: matrix transform. tau_row Additive regularizer row sums abs(). Typically corresponds inflating (absolute) -degree node tau_row. Defaults NULL, case set tau_row mean (absolute) row sum . tau_col Additive regularizer column sums abs(). Typically corresponds inflating (absolute) -degree node tau_col. Defaults NULL, case set tau_col mean (absolute) column sum . iform Invertiform object describing transformation.

title: Construct and use the Regularized Laplacian — RegularizedLaplacian
text: RegularizedLaplacian() creates RegularizedLaplacian object. transform() returns transformed matrix, typically Matrix. inverse_transform() returns inverse transformed matrix, typically Matrix.

title: Construct and use the Regularized Laplacian — RegularizedLaplacian
text: define regularized Laplacian \(L^\tau()\) \(n \times n\) graph adjacency matrix \(\) $$   L^\tau()_{ij} = \frac{A_{ij}}{\sqrt{d^{}_i + \tau_{row}}   \sqrt{d^{}_j + \tau_{col}}} $$ $$   d^{}_i = \sum_{j=1}^n \| A_{ij} \| $$ $$   d^{}_j = \sum_{=1}^n \| A_{ij} \|. $$ \(A_{ij}\) denotes present edge node \(\) node \(j\), fairly standard notation, \(d^{}_i\) denotes (absolute) -degree node \(\) \(d^{}_j\) denotes (absolute) -degree node \(j\). \(\tau_{row}\) additive -degree regularizer \(\tau_{col}\) additive -degree regularizer. Note documentation renders clearly https://rohelab.github.io/invertiforms/.
